intro: Sagina apetala var. chilensis, commonly known as the Chilean sandwort, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and white or pinkish flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. It is adapted to withstand drought conditions due to its succulent leaves and shallow root system.
